candidates.name: Kathryn Adams
candidates.why_elect: My Public Health Nurse experience defines my commitment to protecting health outcomes of people in our region. We must achieve equity for our communities, especially Māori and Pacific People, those with disabilities and lower socioeconomic status or enduring mental illness—through integrating primary and secondary services.
candidates.why_stand: As a registered nurse with a PhD, experienced in nursing leadership and management roles in clinical practice, hospital management, nursing education and clinical research, I seek re-election to CCDHB.

candidates.name: Letitia O'Dwyer
candidates.why_elect: My experience includes; NGOs, introducing new health technologies, improving access to medicines, initiating trials, and establishing strong national and international healthcare networks. I hold a Bachelor of Science, a Post Grad Diploma in Business, and a Masters in Health Management. I've sat on international and national advisory boards.
candidates.why_stand: 25 years dedicated to the NZ healthcare sector has given me a wide breadth of knowledge into understanding the challenges. It's about embracing them and working together to improve healthcare outcomes. I'd like to be part of the next generation of improvements; developing people, processes, partnerships, technology, and funding.

candidates.name: Chris Kalderimis
candidates.why_elect: I am good at listening and thinking laterally. I think that I can also work with people from different walks of life.
candidates.why_stand: I believe that I have something to offer in the area of healthcare especially after 40 years of general practice and involvement in Hospice and Ambulance governance.

candidates.name: Nathan Clark
candidates.why_elect: I have worked in the health sector for 11 years, including different roles at the Ministry of Health and as the health private secretary to the Minister of Health. I am the strategy and planning manager at Hutt Valley DHB. I live in Porirua with my wife and two children.
candidates.why_stand: I want my health sector expertise and knowledge to contribute to the Board's decisions. I want to help ensure that the decisions are first and foremost based on achieving equity and improving people's health and wellbeing—now and into the future.

candidates.name: Sue Kedgley
candidates.why_elect: I'm an elected Health Board member and an effective and experienced health advocate. As a former MP and parliamentary Health spokesperson, I've led campaigns for better nutrition, aged care and over-use of antibiotics. I have extensive governance experience, experience in the health sector and a passion to improve healthcare.
candidates.why_stand: Our DHB faces big challenges—financial pressures, increasing demand for health services, inequity in healthcare. As a long-term champion of good health, I want to be a voice for our community, an advocate for the vulnerable, and I want to improve the quality and equity of healthcare in our region.

candidates.name: John Apanowicz
candidates.why_elect: I've worked in the health sector for the last 12 years at the Capital and Coast DHB and other health entities. I know the systems, the people and what it takes to deliver results.
candidates.why_stand: I'm a born and bred Wellingtonian, I know our community, and I have the skills and experience to make a real difference. I can do that on the Capital and Coast District Health Board.

candidates.name: Susan Turner
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in Wellington for over 25 years, been involved in healthcare in NZ and Australia. Travelled extensively understanding other international health systems. Involved in health governance. I have tackled really complex issues in health with real success. Courageous, fight for justice, possess integrity and I listen/act.
candidates.why_stand: I am passionate about our healthcare and our community. I want to ensure that the health system is working for us all and making a difference. Our local health system is struggling because of the bureaucracy—we can do better. Listen to our staff and communities.

candidates.name: Marion Clark
candidates.why_elect: I've lived in Wellington for over 30 years. I have over fifty years experience working in the health sector. My experience includes nursing, health services management and board governance, health policy development and management (Ministry of Health), and health workforce regulation in NZ and also overseas.
candidates.why_stand: I am keen to use my considerable health expertise to make a difference to the healthcare services provided to the people of Wellington and ensure that the population is as healthy as it can be. I believe that my knowledge and experience of health can ensure good decision-making.

candidates.name: Letitia Isa
candidates.why_elect: I am a working mum (until my son fell ill). I have literally lived at the Hospital and know the gaps from living it. I am not political or politically correct and have worked for much larger and smaller organisations than CCDHB and bring with me the voice of families.
candidates.why_stand: I am an MBA qualified mother of a chronically ill child with a background in HR and Finance who wants to take the politics out of healthcare. That's why I am standing as a truly independent voice for patients and parents based on real life experience of CCDHB.

candidates.name: Vanessa Simpson
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in the CCDHB region for most of my life. 16 years frontline experience with Wellington Free Ambulance (WFA) has connected me with the real issues in our communities. As a WFA executive, I have strong and productive relationships with primary, secondary and specialist services across the CCDHB.
candidates.why_stand: I feel passionately that healthcare should be patient centred. I'm driven to improve patient outcomes by ensuring those who need healthcare get the highest quality care and support.

candidates.name: Roger Blakeley
candidates.why_elect: I have enjoyed a career in the public service, including being Chief Executive of Ministry for the Environment, Department of Internal Affairs and Porirua City Council. My experience in public policy and public management is directly relevant to the governance challenges for CCDHB and improving health for the region.
candidates.why_stand: I am committed to serving at a governance level to improve healthcare in the CCDHB region. I like working in an area where there are huge challenges and opportunities, like the health system. I am motivated by the chance to make a difference to improve health in the region.

candidates.name: Simon Marsh
candidates.why_elect: This job is about governance, (I heard you yawn) it is is about putting in place policies and strategies that give our amazing medical professionals the tools to provide the best healthcare in NZ. I've been a broadcaster, councillor, board director with considerable governance experience.
candidates.why_stand: I have spent nine years as a Wellington City Councillor in what is regarded as one of the world's most liveable cities. Yet I've seen and experienced gaps in our health care that let people down. I believe we can do better by working more closely within our communities.

candidates.name: Ayesha Verrall
candidates.why_elect: As a specialist doctor I know our health services from the ground up. I know a lot of the people I care for in hospital could have had their illness prevented if only we invested in basic things like vaccination, cancer screening and more accessible general practice.
candidates.why_stand: As a doctor I want you to get the care you need, when you need it. But each year DHBs are asked to do more with less. We need to invest in keeping people healthy and collaborate with local doctors so hospital is available for you when you need it.

candidates.name: David Shand
candidates.why_elect: I have a strong commitment to our public sector. I have a hard head (being realistic, looking at facts and being analytical) but a soft heart (a real concern for the underdog and those in need), which I have applied throughout my extensive governance experience.
candidates.why_stand: I want to contribute to improving the performance of our public health system. While Government determines funding, good DHB governance through sound planning, prioritization, contracting with service providers, rigorous monitoring of financial and service performance and holding senior management accountable is also key to improving performance.

candidates.name: John Peters
candidates.why_elect: Have many doctors in my family who advise me from time to time how DHB should be running.
candidates.why_stand: Migrant voices also need to be heard.

candidates.name: Eileen Brown
candidates.why_elect: I have a track record of accountability to the people in the region that this DHB serves through being responsive, developing and building relationships and reporting back on issues that have been raised. I am proud to be an endorsed Labour Party candidate and this ensures additional accountability.
candidates.why_stand: I'm ambitious for our DHB to be delivering the best health services in Wellington, Porirua and Kāpiti so people get the health services they need and deserve. My strengths on the Board are my nursing background, experience on the DHB Board, understanding of health issues and my strong community connections.

candidates.name: Ana Coffey
candidates.why_elect: I have nine years local government experience as a city councillor, three years as deputy mayor. I am currently a DHB board member. I have been a strong advocate for my community, reflecting the challenges and opportunities that we face.
candidates.why_stand: I believe the DHB should reflect the diversity of the community. I have been a strong advocate for equity. My community is most affected by underinvestment in our health outcomes. The health dollar is stretched, so I'm focussed on investing in a health system that delivers quality services for everyone.

candidates.name: Glenda Hughes
candidates.why_elect: I worked in government the private sector and health. I have been a Chair of a major commercial organisation, I also sit on philanthropic boards and charities that address NZ's social issues. I am currently on the Parole Board, Kids Can and Pet Refuge.
candidates.why_stand: I have supported the leadership of Canterbury and Capital Coast District Health Boards executives in the management of difficult challenges including the overseeing of the CCDHB lab implementation. And I am committed to ensuring that everyone has access to the health care they need in a fair society.
